meanings.definition: relating to a spiritual or nonphysical realm beyond the material world
meanings.sent1: The painting depicted a transcendental scene, showing a world beyond our own.
meanings.sent2: Her belief in angels was transcendental, going beyond what most people could understand.
meanings.sent3: The transcendental music made the audience feel like they were floating in the air.
meanings.sent4: His love for her was so strong, it felt almost transcendental, like a force of nature.
meanings.sent5: The sunset painted the sky in transcendental colors, as if from another world.

meanings.sent1: The athlete's performance was transcendental, breaking all previous records.
meanings.sent2: The beauty of the waterfall was truly transcendental, beyond what words could describe.
meanings.sent3: Her cooking skills were so transcendental that she could turn simple ingredients into gourmet dishes.
meanings.sent4: The mountain peak offered a transcendental view, stretching as far as the eye could see.
meanings.sent5: The bond between the twins was transcendental, stronger than anything they had ever experienced.

meanings.definition: a philosophy emphasizing the intuitive and spiritual above the empirical and material
meanings.sent1: She found solace in transcendentalism, seeking answers beyond the physical world.
meanings.sent2: Transcendentalism encourages individuals to connect with nature and their inner selves.
meanings.sent3: The transcendentalism class sparked lively debates about the importance of intuition.
meanings.sent4: In transcendentalism, the soul is believed to be connected to a higher spiritual reality.
meanings.sent5: The transcendentalism movement inspired many to seek a deeper understanding of the universe.
